The restaurant was a little too dimly lit and the restaurant didn't seem much spacious. Lot of little tables and small chairs seemed to be cramped together and the tables were so close that you could literally hear the other table. The interiors weren't too exquisite but just a couple of Buddha paintings and other Thai art. There was also a sushi bar and again, I found it confined too.  The menu was a one page menu but even now I wonder why they printed them in black. Added to the extremely dim lighting, It was an arduous task to read through the items. We came in for dinner and ordered some starters and our main course. I went for a wok dish - pad prik. All their food were tasting great. They were of good quantity and extremely delicious.  The only downside I found was the restaurant was a tad costlier for the ambience they provide. And the places was too compact and crammed. As soon as I finished my tasty food, I was glad to get running outside to get fresh air!

Thai Lite (Charlotte style) - I should have paid attention to the reviews by Donna D from Hi and Paul S from Chicago, those who mistake this for five stars Thai really don't know better.   We had lunch here twice. The first time I thought the soup were really quite good. We ordered  Crispy basil duck and a lunch special which was nothing special. The duck dish was tasty but I was disappointed it was made of shredded duck meat reconstituted into a largish ball. I gladly paid the dinner price ($19) to order what I wanted, but I expected better. This domestic obsession with "boneless" dishes is really annoying the foodie in me.   The second time we were served what I'm pretty sure was a Japanese soups: rice chicken. Not a bad chicken soup but that's NOT what I go to a Thai restaurant for. We had the Panang curry, which was OK but not rich in flavor, not close. I'd label it as sweet and mild sauce over tasteless shreds of pork.   The other dish was Pad Ma Muang/Cashew Delight which they claim to be stir-fry in a *sweet & chili sauce*. It was NOTHING of the sort, instead it tasted of soy with strong dash of "liquid smoke". The thing is I've OD on freaking Teriyaki and grew to hate it many, many moons ago.  I didn't send it back only because it was lunch time and besides it's not my job to teach them difference between Japanese and Thai cuisine. Those two do not "fuse", they are so dissimilar as to be contradictory cuisines.   I haven't found a really good Thai restaurant around here, and I lost faith I will.

This is the best Thai restaurant in Charlotte in my opinion. The Panang Curry is amazing. Everything is cooked perfectly from the veggies to the protein. The sushi is really good too. I had the Red Dragon roll and it was a great start to an amazing meal. Not the biggest restaurant on the inside so I would strongly suggest making reservations. Also, this place is on the pricier side as others have mentioned but it's well worth every penny. Good service and great food. I will be returning soon!

heard about this place last year and had red curry chicken. loved it ! i love the setting of this place. theres a full bar area, booth & tables and as well as patio seating . i was recommended eggplant stirfry from the owner and that is my fav thing on the menu. i am a big curry fan n deejai is the place where u wAnt to go if you love traditional thai food esp curry dishes.  also to mention great staff and they are happy to help you .

Pros: -The food tastes good... tastes.  Cons: -I always feel terrible the next day. No matter what I order. This is not something that happens to me at any other decent Thai or Sushi restaurant. -Sort of expensive for what I feel I am getting. -Service has never been good. I have been there four times and every time my food has come out incorrectly (I am not picky, I order straight from the menu, nothing weird). One time my friend and I ordered the same thing, and mine took 20 minutes longer to come out, and even then was wrong! How hard is it to get red curry with chicken?  Go/No-Go: I will not be returning. If you want good Thai food, drive a few minutes over to Thai Taste; if you want good Sushi go to Ru Sans or one of the many other restaurants in the area.

I tried the sushi this time, which are pretty good. From the taste to the whole plate set up. The servers are very nice, but I think they need a couple more server on the floor.  I would like to go back to tried the Thai section...

This place came highly recommended and the reviews seemed great. So I was glad when I saw a coupon for $40 worth of food for $20. (I should have known better) Wow, I didn't know that you could ruin Pad-Thai that badly. I should have known the place not going to be good when I ordered Jasmine Tea and he brought me a cup of hot water and a tea chest. I should have gotten up and left. At least I would have had a decent meal instead of the travesty that they gave us. My wife and I love Asian food. But to me this place doesn't even qualify as Thai. It's more like a fusion restaurant that tries to do much at once and does it all badly. The place is too loud, too cramped and the waiters need to take comprehension lessons. We asked for the Sushi special a Tsunami roll, we got the Samurai roll instead. The Pad Thai tasted like it was made by a kid that worked at Nothing but Noodles. I mean," Come on, this is the supposed to be the signature dish of Thailand." It's supposed to be full and flavorful tasting. It's not even supposed to look like pink, limp noodles that have been over cooked. ( The HORROR!) If you like traditional Thai food run the other direction. If you have never tried Thai or like typical mall food Asian fare then this place is for you because you don't know any better. What a waste if an evening! ddc

Went for dinner and ordered aggressively for two: Chicken Larb Cashew Delight Duck Curry And the Rainbow Roll  The food was not that great to be honest. The chicken lard was good. I would get that again. Cashew delight was pretty good. Did not like the duck curry at all and as a sushi lover the rainbow roll was disappointing.   Overall was decent food but nothing stands out and would not go back. Highly overpriced for the quality and taste.
This place never disappoints me.   Love the duck dish.  It s by far one of the best I have had in Charlotte.  Kang Dan Ped

Been here a few times. My BF usually gets the chicken pad thai, he likes it. A little sweet for me though.  I've had the larb, not bad. Tonight I'm having the basil fried rice with chicken. It's fantastic. Tons of firm veggies, just enough spice and the thai basil gives great flavor.

Yummy! Love the Mountain Beef, Pad See U, and Tom Yum Soup with shrimp. In-dining experience is GREAT and makes for a nice casual dinner date but take out during the week is my favorite. Easy parking, punctual service, coupons, and hot ready to eat delicious food.

I always forget Deejai Thai exists because it's tucked away next to the Manor, but it popped up on my radar screen one Wednesday night, and away we went.    I like going to Deejai a little bit later on a weeknight because parking is easier in the strip mall lot, and when it's full, it feels full.  Honestly, the crowd usually makes it or breaks it for me.  The night we went most recently, it was about half full and felt energetic, and I didn't feel like I needed to scoot my chair all the way in til it hit my spleen to get some room.  However, I do love that it's dark and romantic... because then I don't have to wear makeup.  The service was prompt as usual, and I got the chicken pad thai ($12.99) while the fella got beef pad see u ($12.99).  Since it was a Wednesday night, one of their bottles of wine was half off, so we got that, too!  I was in the Clean Plate Club after about 20 minutes of inhaling my dinner, and the fella said his was good but mine was better.  I really need to do a better job of remembering that Deejai is out there.  Now if only I could figure out how to pronounce it...

Love Thai food here! But just don't order sushi, at least not for lunch. My samurai roll was oozing with cream cheese, like I was eating a bagel instead of sushi. I couldn't finish it. They very graciously took it back and I asked for simple spicy tuna roll in its stead. And regretted it; not fresh at all. Same with Eel. My friend on the other hand cleaned his plate of green curry. Lesson learnt.

Thai food is one of my favorites. It's some of the best comfort food.   Since moving to CLT I've had a hard time finding Thai food that I really like.   Deejai is pretty good! I ate in the restaurant for the first time this week - I typically do take out from there.   I like their pad see ew and drunken noodles.   While I like their dishes, I wished they used proper noodles for the dish. They should be made with wide noodles.   This place can get super busy on the weekends so keep that in mind if you're planning to go for dinner.
Hands down the best Thai food in Charlotte. Can be a little on the pricey side, and service is hit or miss, but the quality of food is always excellent. Must try the green curry and Thai beef salad.

I've definitely had worse, and I've definitely had better. I ordered the Pad Thai, he ordered the Pad See U... everything was good, and my server was very helpful when my two-star Pad Thai turned out to be MUCH hotter than I was anticipating. Despite the swanky decor and fairly good reviews, I just wasn't blown away by the food. I'll stick with the more casual places like Lang Van or Saigon Palace in the future.

We were seated promptly tonight, staff was very efficient, food was very good, i had pad prik and springrolls, wife had thai jerky and basil fried rice.... she was hoping for more veggies in rice... otherwise, all was good.... best ive had?, no.... top 3?, yes.

Love love love this place! Everything about it, food, atmosphere, service is all wonderful. This is my go-to when I'm craving Thaj food and I will be in soon! Pad see ew is awesome as well as fresh rolls. Have never had a bad meal here!
Food took over an hour to come out. Wasn't only our table everyone around us had the same issue. Food just takes way too long to come out not worth coming here avoid

Top notch service paired with an excellent menu. I'm a huge Thai fan and this place just rocks all around. The atmosphere is perfect and the staff is super friendly and ready to accommodate. Can't wait to visit again!!

OK so my mother-out-of-law is a Thai nut... as a matter of fact the first time i ever ate Thai was with her in California the first time I met her... she knows good Thai and she loves this place and I continue to not be disapointed when dining there since she made this declaration.  The wine list is adequate, the service is acceptably attentive and the Thai dishes and the specials (which encompass all) are thoughtful and well prepared.  Tonight had the scallop green curry and though they were out of aubergine was still spicy and wonderful.  Tuna starter special was great as well with the perfect amount of seaweed salad.  Not really sure how to say one Thia is above another because I have limited expertise, but this place works like a charm for us!

Thai restaurants in Charlotte are either over priced and average or just plain average!  Last week while looking for lunch off of our beaten path, I remembered Deejai.  The place I forget I want to try, and I'm so glad I remembered.  After walking in the door, and loving the enviroment, nice big doors, and windows,  bam, there was complimentary chicken soup and some kind of pork thingies. Neither which I eat so, I ordered some Tom Kha tofu soup and it was delicious.  Iced Thai coffee and some green curry tofu, freakin awesome and great prices!     I couldn't stop talking about this place, and how I complain about no good cheap Thai food in CLT, so we ate it again last night for dinner.  Two thumbs up is what I say,  PadTar w/ tofu, spicy, heck ya it's good. Service is nice and quick and the prices are extremely affordable.    It's so nice to find new things in CLT.-

Just left here some minutes ago,,, nice staff and decor.  But the food was not up to Thai standards. The drunken noodles, Basil fried rice we ordered wasn't great. I'm sure they could do better with the taste in the future. The food tasted more like Japanese cuisine.

Deejai, how I love thee. You have, by far, the best Thai food in Charlotte. As much as I enjoy eating within your walls, I like doing take out even more. This past Sunday, we feasted on your Drunken Noodles with pork (Pad See U), Ocean Roll, and Green Curry with Duck. Holy moly. Everything was amazing, but the green curry put me into food heaven. I want to bathe in it. I've never been disappointed with you and can't wait to go back soon (ALSO, I love that you always have coupons on the back of my Harris Teeter receipts).
Service was at best slow, calimari undercooked, Tom Yum was good.There are better Thai restaurants in Charlotte

Met up with some friends for dinner.  This was my first time at Deejai Thai.  I have been wanting to try this place for a long time.  I was impressed with the food and will be back.    We had a few things and will highlight them.  Started with the spring rolls and bahn mi for appetizers.   Both were done really well.  The Bahn Mi had a lot of flavor.  The spring rolls were cooked to perfection. I would recommend both.  I had the panang curry with chicken for my main.  The portion and flavor were on point.  I had them take out the vegetables (just how I like it).    Service was okay to good.  They get so busy that everyone is racing around.  It's a good / bad thing.  Overall there were no issues but could have been a little better   The inside is comfortable.  The location has a fair amount of seating and the pack them in.  Nothing too bad but they utilize the space.  I think that there is a patio but not useful in the winter.    Overall the food is really good.  Service could be a little better but this is a place that I would go back.

My fraternity brother, Steve, was in town today from Greensboro and I had to figure out where to take him for lunch.  We were taking a tour of Charlotte and as we were nearing the famous Myer's Park area, I remembered that there is a Thai restaurant that I have never tried.  So, we popped into Deejai Thai. It was lunch time and there were not a lot of patrons.  It was a quiet day with nice soft music playing. We were quickly seated and served a complimentary bowl of soup and fried won tons, which were delicious.  Our entrees followed. I had the spicy Lemongrass chicken and Steve had the Basil Chicken.  Our tongues had to get accustomed to the spicy flavor (more than we expected), but we loved our dishes.  This restaurant has an urban feel to it, not an overly Asian vibe.  Everything about it suited our tastes, from the atmosphere to the service to the delicious food.   It's a good thing that this restaurant is next to the Manor Theatre as I already imagine going back for a movie and another Thai dish!  Two Thumbs up, DEFINITELY!

We gave this place one more try and had the exact same issues as our last visit- mediocre food (some highlights, but not enough) and not so great service.  Ended up waiting to get a even though it wasn't crowded - the wait was more about lack of attention to arriving customers. Service was very slow and My noodle dish was just ok, hubby's basil chicken was definitely the highlight. My shrimp were way over cooked, not near enough veggies on the dish and the sauce was overly sweet and one note. Appetizers were decent, got the dumplings and a roll. Overall not worth coming back - 2x and your out.

Green Curry was tasty.  I wish there was more curry soup to spread across my rice.  The spring rolls were aromatic with basil.  The sauce was the best I've ever had!  The restaurant was small and cozy with a sushi bar.  That's quite different for a Thai spot but who doesn't like sushi these days.

Had a great dinner here! I got the shrimp and avacado salad which was fresh, flavorful and light. Others at the table got the chicken pad thai, scallops and a beef dish, and everyone seemed quite happy.   My only complaint was our entrees came out before the appetizer sushi. We were told that there was only one sushi chef working, but we shouldn't have been charged in my opinion.  Great food though, will definitely go back!
Unimpressed. We ordered takeout from here on valentine's day. Portion size left much to be desired. The chicken in both our pad see ew and panang curry was very dry and chewy.

The food was excellent but walked in at 2:45 and it was very obvious the hostess wasn't happy about it. She told me they closed at 3:00. I started to leave but they were open. Not at all welcoming. Won't go back, at least for a good while.

Great for dining in or take out. I wish they delivered, and I'll continue hoping. The basil rolls are fresh and delicious. The larb is crazy good and the perfect level of spicy. I order with lettuce bc I don't care for cabbage. The sushi is some of the best in town, but orders can sometimes take a while because they only have one sushi guru (at least from the times I've dined). My fianc√© likes their pad Thai a lot, and he's picky about pad Thai. I'm not giving 5 stars bc the menu is a bit overpriced. But it's excellent quality and in Myers Park.

Thai might just be my favorite of the international cuisines we have "Americanized" and adopted in the States.  Fresh herbs and veggies, delicate noodles and spicy sauces- what's not to like?  I'm happy to say DeeJai is a fine representative of the class.  I usually go here with co-workers for lunch.  Seating is pretty much always available and on nice days there are a few tables in a narrow outdoor courtyard.  Decor is modern but not over the top, nothing too jarring.  There is a full bar and now a sushi bar at the front end of things.  My only minor complaint with the setting is the constant playing of an "all-acoustic" Sirius radio station.  A little muted variety might be nice- I can only take so much Sting with my curries, after all.  The lunch here is a pretty good deal- compared to what else is in the area.  You get an appetizer (usually a single crab rangoon) along with a small bowl of a soup that changes, but no mind, it has always been tasty.  Combined with the main dish, you're looking at about $8-10.    There are a few standards here- basil chicken, pad thai, and panang curry, but there are also a number of entrees, including salads and fish dishes- you can be as adventurous as you like.    For me, the pad thai is NOT good here.  Maybe I've become too accustomed to Thai Taste and Thai House, but the flavor of of the Pad Thai here is way off for me, I avoid it.  No worries, though, because there are plenty of other options here.  My personal favorite is the panang curry with pork.  The curry is just right without having me breathing fire.  I literally try and scoop of the last of the sauce with my chopsticks.  My co-worker is partial to the spicy basil chicken, and it always smells tempting.  Both dishes comes with a generous portion of rice- not so with noodle dishes.  There is also a green curry and pad prik, both of which vie for my affection.  You get your choice of meat, or you can go vegetarian (not a bad choice).  Be aware this place is now closed on Mondays, sad but true side if effect of the current economy.  The new sushi menu looks very tempting, though I have not tried it yet.  The sushi chef stands around without much to do, so I can't comment here.    In all, this place is solid for both interesting entrees and some well executed favorites.  I give these guys a lot of credit, it's well-executed Thai without the crazy outfits or wall decor.  I'm all in.

Great authentic Thai food. I had the garlic eggplant and it was delicious I definitely recommend it. Also had the Thai iced tea and it was also good. Only complaint is the veggies on the pad see we could have been cooked more it was a bit on the raw side for me.

So I was in the mood for some Thai food but did not feel like taking my usual hike over to Thai Taste, so I opted instead for Deejai. I was in the mood for some Thai fried rice and after looking through the yelp pictures came across a pictured of "curry fried rice". In the picture it look delicious and so I made my selection.  I placed my order to be told that they did not serve curry fried rice. Knowing that sometimes reviews mislabel their food selections, I said "ok well I'll just take the Thai fried rice with tofu".  25 minutes later I went in to pick up the food.   Parking was kind of a pain, but I was able to score a place in the back lot after patiently waiting it out for a few mins. The place was booming, crowd was a mix of young and old, and inside was traditional yet modern.  I picked up my order and went back to my car. Something told me to check my food before I sped off, and once I did I was confused. The appeared to not have been fried at all, there were no carrots, scallions, cucumber, etc. and tasted as it appeared, flavorless.  I immediately went back and showed the front seat rep and asked "Is this what your fried rice supposed to look like?" Confused she mentioned that it doesn't look that way and called somebody to assist me.  The next person came and I showed him the same thing. His first response  was that that is hie their regular fried rice is. I asked where are the additional ingredients and that is traditional to Thai rice and he mentioned that if I would of ordered basil fried rice I would have gotten more. There is not any mention of basil fried rice on the menu, nor was what I received worth the nearly $15 I paid. I kindly asked for a refund which he graciously, without any arguments provided.  So just a word of caution for anyone ordering Thai fried rice, make sure you clarify what exactly you are getting, otherwise you will be faced with disappointment  and confusion like I was.y

From the outside, this place look pretty casual. Inside, not so much! Dress it up dressy/casual with your date to enjoy a moderate-priced menu. Our meals were tasty, and from scanning the other tables-- there were no disappointed faces!

Great service, very good food, nice layout... I am a repeat diner who loves this local restaurant.   The staff genuinely appreciates you being there... wow... no sales/food pitches, good recommendations.

Went here for a birthday dinner with 11 other friends, and everyone had  a great time and good food!  Tried the basil wraps and really enjoyed them - we make these at home alot, but the sauce that came with them really kicked it up a notch (spicy thai chile).  I ordered the Pan Prik, level 4 hotness with prawns and enjoyed the meal - while I thought it would be hotter, the flavors were fun and the portion size was perfect.   The cons were that sushi took 45 minutes to arrive at our table (the waitress did warn those who ordered it) and their pricing was a bit high for some things I felt.  Their menu is large, the environment is modern but cozy. I would go back, but this wouldn't be the first place I'd suggest for dinner.

My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Consistently delicious and the service is always super sweet and helpful. I always get the Pad Prik Duck or Shu She Salmon. Their sushi is also very delicious, I love the Red Dragon Roll. Atmosphere is casual yet romantic, and the live music on Thursdays is very good. LOVE it.

Ordered take out from here recently. When I got there I was handed a bag that was tied at the top. I paid and went home. When I got home I found there was no rice to go with my panang curry. Without rice, panang curry to me is really expensive soup.  So I called back and after a little back and forth they had someone drive some rice to my house.  They did the right thing and the food was delicious. So nice to have a restaurant that cares about their customers in the neighborhood and that happens to make really really good thai food.  I will definitely be back!

I love the food here. It is consistently delicious. The flavors are full and complex. The rating for my review is solely based on service. I have been here twice in the last few weeks and both times waited at least 10-15 minutes for my order to be taken. Once was a larger party and tonight was my family of three. Neither time has the restaurant been at capacity.  Once our order was taken service improved primarily from the manager checking on our table, not the server. This is not unusual but more the standard I've experienced here. If I didn't love their food, I would not come back.

Solid spot for a flavorful lunch or dinner! They're almost always running a Groupon or Living Social deal. So, if you pay full price, you're doing it wrong.   Consistency is a bit of a struggle -- I've had a grill beef salad one day that almost burnt the tastebuds off my tongue it was so spicy and then the next week the grill beef salad is so mild I had to ask for a little chili sauce to spice it up.   At lunch, they give you a cup of soup and some crunchy noodles on the house. They're also on Postmates, which comes in handy those days I can't escape the office. Oooooor, don't want to leave the house.

By far my favorite Thai place in Charlotte and believe me I've been to A LOT. The Pad Thai is my go to and the flavor here is perfect. Make sure you stop in for lunch for the complimentary soup and fried wontons and chili sauce. You'll catch me here on Wednesday's when the soup of the day is the Tom Kha. I've been coming for over 4 years and they remain consistent. They remember my order and by they I mean ALL the servers. I don't even have to speak. Try it. You'll fall in love!

Really tasty Thai food! I ordered delivery with Postmates, the chicken veggie stir fry and chicken fried rice. Both dishes were really good! Stir fry had a lot of flavor.  Light on the chicken on the fried rice but so delish!

The service was good but I wasn't a huge fan of the pad thai.  The chicken had a very distinct taste as if it was a seperate dish, instead of it being part of the dish. I also had thai tea and that was very sweet.

Where should I start. Ok my boyfriend and I had been there before so we know what we likes. We order sushi and pad thai chicken but we had a different lady waiting on us. So she went and put in the order and the sushi is out first cool no problem. Than I waited until she come over and I asked about my pad thai and she asked me "oh u order pad thai too" Yeah.. so we already done finish our sushi. Later our pad thai is out.  So by now I'm already full so I ask for the check and box. We used groupons AND I feel like she had an attitude with us using coupons. My reasoning is that she didn't speak a word to us after my boyfriend handed her, his phone to use coupon.  If y'all don't like guest to use coupons than don't advise it on groupon. I mean im NOT sorry for the fact that she didn't get my order right because she didn't write it down!. But we still gave her a 20% good tips after all that.

They have a great menu - one of the most expansive of all the Thai restaurants in Charlotte.   For example, where else can you find steamed flounder in a yellow curry, or fried salmon curry.  My favorite is the Soft Shell Crab in a Panang Curry which I had last night. Be warned though that service can be slow for dinner.  Lunch is no problem.

Had dinner here tonight.  Definitely a fan!  I ordered the drunken noodles with chicken and asked for a "level 3 star" spiciness.  I've always wanted to try the place since I didn't know what it was when it first appeared next to the Manor Theater.  Truthfully, my group of friends were supposed to grab a quick dinner and then a movie, but the movie ended up being sold out- we decided to have a nice dinner instead.  Wait staff was really nice and kept the water glasses full the whole time we were eating.  Especially needed that water with a level 3!  I usually don't go for spicy, thinking that the heat will ruin my experience with the food, but tonight I felt adventurous and it paid off in the end.  It was an overall nice dinner experience with good wine, conversation, and of course food!

I had heard so many good things about Deejai and have been wanting to try it.  When a friend from high school was in town and suggested Thai, this was my opportunity.    When we got there around 8:30pm on a Saturday, the place was full but we were seated in the basement which has quite a different atmosphere than upstairs.  Upstairs seemed noisy and busy whereas downstairs was more intimate with mood lighting and "Chill" music playing.  We were both quite impressed with the atmosphere.   The food was amazing.  I had an Asian lemongrass entree which was spicy like I like it.  Normally, Thai restaurants can be hit or miss  with spice levels but at this one, I ordered a 4 star dish and it did not disappoint.  In fact, the spice was not apparent at first bite but it lingered which is exactly how I like it.    The only thing I could fault Deejai on is the number of choices on the menu.  It was very difficult to make a decision.

Gotta love Thai food.   Went to Deejai a few months back with the wife. It was our first time and we enjoyed it. Back in VA, my parents are big fans of Thai food so needless to say we kind of overdid it. But once the Thai craving presented itself we had to give Deejai a shot.   The atmosphere is nice and I recall it being pretty crowded on that random weeknight that we went. The service was very warm and attentive too. There wasn't a wait, but it was very lively on that particular weeknight, but the service was still great.  Now onto the food. one word: delicious. I had the Tom Yum soup, we split some spring rolls, and my entree was the Pad Takrai, a delicious, spicy beef dish. I love spicy and it was terrific.   You have to give Deejai a shot if you're a fan of Thai food. They have sushi too, but I didn't try it so I can't comment. But it's really good food and great prices and attentive service.   A+

Deejai, I want to love you. I do. Sometimes you take me in your arms and give me what I crave. Other times, it's like you aren't even there, like you don't care any more. I deserve better than this, but I keep coming back to you.   It's embarrassing when someone I care about comes into town and it's my responsibility to take them to a favorite local place and really show off what Charlotte has to offer. And I bring them to, say, Deejai Thai. We order. We get two bland dishes. We send them back and reorder, and get 1 amazing dish and another bland dish. I can't keep going like this, Deejai. I need someone who's there for me all the time.   I want to give this place a 3, earned wholeheartedly by their curries, spring rolls and their drunken noodle. They are hands down the best in the area. But without the support of a good Pad Thai and many other dishes, I can't reasonably give this more than a 2.   Stray not beyond the confines of those few dishes, for you will wander into a world where taste, spice and flavor have been forsaken. And you will be sad, and embarrassed if you've talked the place up to an out-of-towner.   Celebrity most likely to enjoy eating here:  Charlie Sheen: I imagine he'd be too drunk to care about the blandness of the dishes.   Half hour to live and I have to get my last meal here:  The drunken noodle never disappoints.
Really fresh and amazing.  Lunch service is great with the free appetizer.  Great ambiance and a really cute little patio area.  LOVE!

The sushi and thai dishes here are amazing.  I love to get a curry dish with a request that it be a level 3 spicy, which is the spiciest.  The sushi here is amazing, as well.  I would definitely make a reservation on the weekends if you can.  There is usually a Groupon offer - $22 for $40 but they are currently sold out of those so that was a disappointment.  My boyfriend and I consider this "our place" because we went nuts here one night and everything was absolutely amazing!

My wife, 16 month old and I dined in on 11/3/2013. All 3 of us got bad food poisioning within a day. The little one started throwing up in about 4 hrs. Food was tasty but the service was not good. I will never go here again.

We were seated right away without a reservation on a Tuesday night. With the groupon the restaurant has been offering. My fianc√© and I have been wanting to try this place for a while now. I'm so glad we did. The service was quick and precise. The food was delicious. I got a scallop dish with pretty much Thai basil stir fry and my fianc√© got chicken panang curry. Both were amazing, I would say even more portion sizes than I expected. We also got the spring rolls for appetizer which normally comes with 2 but came with 4 for an unexpected surprise. They also have a large lot but shared with a small movie theatre and Panera so keep in mind when you visit, you might need to park behind the building. I am so glad though I found a great Thai place so close!

4 friends first time here.  Using a Groupon, on a Sunday. Not that impressed with service.  Arrived at 5pm opening, seat promptly.  A couple tables already seated. Ordered Larb (chicken) good, but never seen it served with a slab of raw cabbage. Awkward to eat, and also served with lettuce underneath it,  lettuce got warm and soggy. Green chicken curry, excellent, shrimp and chicken pad Thai good but slightly dry, more sauce please.  Most disappointing was the coconut soup. Lots of cabbage, don't know what the obsession with cabbage is all about??   it did have plenty of  but the Bahn mi and soup  had NO cilantro!  When I asked for a side of it to add to both menu items that listed it, the server came back and said they were out!  Seriously, both items have cilantro as a Intercal part of recipe. And was missed.  Should have been told, so I could decide.   Appreciated the 96.5 sanitation rating.
Worst fried rice ever!  Rice had the consistency of pudding  Also tried their sushi which was very flavorless.     Will not be going back

If you prefer sodium rich food then I would say this is your place! The food was more sodium based than the usual Thai spices I taste when eating Thai food.  The service was okay, and overall it was yuck!  If you want delicious Thai, I would recommend Thai 1st Bistro in Charlotte or Kanikai in Greenville, SC.  As a vegetarian they are more geared to accommodating the veggies and carnivores enjoy their dishes. Just stay away from this place or you'll end up drinking more water to clean out your system.
We have had multiple visits to Deejai and they are always on point. They did change their menu a bit and I liked the older menu better. The green curry - Thai spicy is amazing.

We went to Deejai Thai last weekend in search of a flavorful dinner and they were able to provide exactly what we were looking for.  We decided to sit outside to enjoy the lovely NC spring weather in their side patio - and we were both impressed on how much they had done to make their little space relaxing and elegant. Our drinks came in trendy mason jars, and my Thai iced tea was the perfect drink to enjoy outside!  We started with the Jeeb Sai Moo / Curry Pot Sticker, which was served in a light curry sauce, but there wasn't much seasoning on the filling of the pot stickers, which was disappointing.  My main dish Pad Kra Prao/spicy Basil chicken was fantastic! The portion that came out was more than filling for dinner and lunch the next day. The menu listed this item as "spicy level 3" but there was more basil flavor than spice. My only complaint with the dish was the half shallot randomly in with the ground chicken and other chopped vegetables. My boyfriend ordered the green curry, which he said he is often unable to find at Thai restaurants in Charlotte. We will definitely return to sample more items off of their menu. I would also recommend this location for those unfamiliar with Thai food, since the menu has extensive explanations for each item and their descriptions are full of personality making for an interesting read. For example the Pad Prik is described as "oooooh! this is so spicy and healthy that there must be some mistake because the flavor is awesome."

I went to Deejai Thai for dinner yesterday and really enjoyed it. I decided to go with the Lemongrass chicken and it was spicy but mouthwatering. I opted for noodles rather than rice and it wasn't a problem. The dinner portion was a great size for $12.99, and it would be enough for leftovers (though I'll admit I ate the entire thing). I also tried a bite of the Pad Prik which was slightly less spicy but very flavorful as well. I loved all of the veggies in both dishes- they were plentiful but light at the same time.   We started with spring rolls and basil rolls- both were tasty- but I don't think I am as big of a fan of basil rolls as some of the other folks here though as I could have gone without them.   The atmosphere is nice & clean, and the service was good as well.   I will definitely be back to try some of their other dishes. Great prices and delicious food!

Although I've only been once, I most likely won't be going back. The food was OK, but the flavors were nothing special. I had the Mussaman Curry for an entree and it mostly just tasted like peanuts. We had the Pot Stickers to start off, and although the sauce was delicious the dumplings themselves were a little soggy and lacked flavor. The other entree we had as the Pad See U, and that turned out to be overly salty. Maybe we just went on a bad night, but I was pretty unimpressed with the food we tried.

This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Great curries, soup, Pad Thai, and even the sushi is  first class. Order food at a #2 spice level unless you're a professional. So glad they opened another restaurant in No Da.

i have been here a handful of times and always enjoyed it but forgot to review it. ive pretty much just stuck with standard thai fare @ deejai thai and it never disappoints, solid pad thai, VERY SOLID green curry, i like hot food and 3 star isnt hot but their thai hot can remove the skin from your mouth and have you ordering glasses of milk so be careful.  i had one of their flounder specials one night and it was devine, spring rolls and great, green papaya salad is spot on (very traditional thai salad and amazing if done right).  the people that work their are friendly and nice, they do a great job with take-out BUT BUT BUT they have crammed too many tables onto their dining room floor so if you have more than 4 people there, i think, is only one table that can accomadate your group and elbow room is @ a premium when they are packed.  other than the tight floor i really like deejai thai.  its a great place to go when on a date or with another couple or foursome.  reasonably priced, nice atmosphere, and great locale.  this is probably the 3rd best thai place in charlotte, the first two are dynamite so dont let that 3rd ranking fool you and thai food is my second favorite cusine so im eating it all the time.  deejai is good, go try it

Deejai has some of the best curry in Charlotte.  The red curry is the best, but the Penang is a close second.   I have had multiple sushi rolls (red dragon pictured) and the seafood is fresh and the rolls are tasty.  There aren't any sushi lunch specials so do expect to pay around $14 for a specialty roll.  The rolls are average size.     I recommend trying one of their lunch specials or getting a groupon/living social to make the prices more reasonable.

Compared to the food in Thailand, this would only earn one star. That's a tough comparison, so I'll also put it up against the Thai food from my hometown (Baton Rouge) where Deejay would still fall in the mediocre bracket. It's probably the worst of the four Charlotte Thai restaurants I have had so far.  I'm still searching for something that holds a candle to my two favorites back home where the Thai ladies serve truly authentic food.    I'll give Deejay one nice comment...the quality of the ingredients was good.  We started with the Basil Rolls which, aside from the Thai Basil leaves and plum sauce, was super boring. I know the point is for these to be refreshing, but I found that they contained too much of what seemed to be iceberg lettuce.  My husband tried the Panang Curry for his meal. First red flag should have been the questionable tone we heard when we were specifying hotness. Really? It's Thai curry - you HAVE to decide how much pain you want. We requested medium hot, which had no hotness whatsoever. Maybe Thai hot here in Charlotte would render a dish with some heat.  We loaded the dish up with Thai chili paste when eating the meal at home.  I normally go for green curry when trying a new place, or maybe some Tom Yum to start, but I was feeling really chill the day I ordered and went with Pad See U.  I've had this other places and the real star is usually high quality rice noodles which is balanced with a dark soy based sauce.  It's for the non-adventurous type, kind of like fried rice, but it was just what I was craving that evening. The dish I got was like my failed attempts to replicate the dish at home....maybe worse. The noodles were tiny fragments. They likely came dried in a Thai Kitchen package. The sauce was a yawn.   This is just another one of Charlotte's over priced Thai places, so I'd suggest moving along to the next option on your list of places to try. We won't be back.

Let me start off by saying that the food here was very good and if I just had to judge them by food I would give them 4 or maybe even 5 stars. We ordered the green curry with scallops and eggplant, the Pad Prik and the basil rolls. Everything was delicious! The green curry was mild yet full of flavor. I think they have at least three different kinds of green curries, but the scallops one was good, especially the eggplant part. Usually eggplant (if not cooked all the way) makes my tongue itch and I've heard it happens to a bunch of people, but theirs was very well made and I felt nothing but bliss on my tongue. Careful with the Pad prik though, it can get spicy. If you are not very good with spicy, you might want to ask them for a spice level 2 (default is 3), but I would never make the mistake of making it 4 or more unless you KNOW you and your insides can handle it. The basil rolls were really good as well. All the flavors melded well and the sauce was not too peanutty. Someone else from our party had the mango pudding with rice for dessert and were really happy with it. They said the mango had a very nice flavor. The ambience was nice as well.  My only problem was that these guys don't have a baby changing station despite having a big bathroom. We had a four month old baby with us who needed to be changed so I accompanied her momma to help out and was very surprised to not see a baby changing station. The bathroom was big enough to fit one in, but nope. We had to lay the baby down on the floor (of course we put a changing mat under her) and it was just weird for her mommy and I to be squatting down by the toilet, trying to change her up while she kept wriggling around and flailing her hands off the mat on the bathroom floor. Normally I wouldn't strike down the stars to three for not having a changing station, but last night's experience with a baby and us on the bathroom floor was just not a nice experience at all. Also, the server took forever to bring our checks. We were just sitting there for 10-15 minutes after we finished out dinner and the plates were cleared, just waiting for the server to bring us our checks. I'm not sure I would go here with a family again, but for date night it might be good.

Atmosphere is nice. Server was nice. But I got the drunken spicy noodles and it was not spicy at all even though I asked for it to be more spicy than 3 stars. I liked the udon noodles but it really lacked flavor. We got the Tom yum with seafood and it was warm not hot. Huge chunks of tomatoes in it and hardly any seafood. I definitely wouldn't get that again.

First wanted to say, the food has phenomenal flavor, came in last night, ordered pad see ew, pad thai, thai fried rice (one of the best i'd ever had), and fresh basil rolls... Only issue we had was on the Pad Thai... I would definitely check your limes out, because the one that was squeezed on our dinner entree was extremely bitter, and totally ruined the pad thai.  Typically, when trying new thai restaurants, I'll get an order of Pad Thai to get a good feel of quality.  While the other dishes delivered, this one failed to hit the mark. I did contact the restaurant via Facebook and was unable to garner a response.

I give this place 3.5 stars. We were seated right away and decided to ordered drunken noodles with shrimp and panang curry with chicken to share. We opted with their recommended spice level, a three. Wasn't spicy at all! Next time going with a 4 or 5.  They use a different type of noodles for drunken noodles, I'm used to the recipe calling for flat rice noodles. I believe they used udon. The dish had great flavors but too many bell peppers. Best part was the shrimp. Really big and was cooked right. The panang curry was okay, could've used more spices. Service staff were friendly.   Reason why im giving this place 3 stars is the taste of the food, lack of heat, and was on the pricier end. I can definitely find hole in the wall Thai places with really tasty dishes in la or NYC for cheaper.

I have to be completely honest here. I've been to this restaurant several (ok more than several) times and I've only ever ordered one thing... With that being said, I can really only rate this place off of my addiction and love for their Yellow Curry Shrimp. Strange I know, but I would bathe in this dish if I could. There is something about it that I just can't seem to want to try something new and I like trying new.   What else can I tell you about this place? The service is good and I highly recommend the Yellow Curry Shrimp. Oh! And the Thaitini because Thai iced tea is ridiculously good and mixing it with vodka is like making it my birthday present.

I've been interested in popping by this cute little Thai restaurant in Myers Park for some time now, so I was delighted when husband was in the mood for Thai takeout. This review is solely based on a takeout order, as we didn't have time to eat in!  We brought home the Basil Rolls, the Pad Thai (price level hot) and the Pad Prik (spice level medium). First off, the Basil Rolls were delicious! Hubs and I tore into those immediately when we came home. They consisted of fresh shrimp, sweet basil and bean sprouts wrapped in rice paper and came with a plum sauce for dipping. They were super light and very tasty. For $4, that's a nice deal. Two orders of these would be great for a healthy lunch!  My meal was the (spicy) Pad Thai. I decided to take a walk on the wild side and order it at this spice level as some of the reviews mentioned that Deejai's regular Pad Thai can be lacking in the spice department. Holy hot. It was tasty, but super spicy. Durr.   The flavors of their Pad Thai were good, but not great. The peanut sauce was a little too thick for my liking and some of the noodles stuck together a bit. I prefer a lighter Pad Thai. I will say, though, this Chicken Pad Thai only cost $10 and left me enough for another (quite large) meal.   While Deejai is not my favorite Thai place in Charlotte, it's fast, friendly and tasty!

We love Deejai!!!  We go there a couple of times a month.  One of my favorite dishes is Vegetable Lovers and add Chicken and ask for Pad Prik sauce with it.   It has great vegetables like broccoli, snow peas, baby corn, zucchini, and cabbage.  Their food ranges from a 1 which is not spicy and all the way to a 5 which is extremely spicy.  We always order our food at a 3 which can be very spicy.  Loved their brown rice with our meals.  My children love the Panther Roll (sushi).  Also love the Pad Prik dish and Pad Thai.  It has great food.

This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte!  They never disappoint and there is something for everyone on the menu.  Pad Prik is my favorite entree.  They can adjust the spiciness of any dish to your liking. I definitely recommend this place, especially for a date!
If I didn't have a Groupon I'd only give it 2 stars. Small hole in the wall in a strip mall. Hair in one dish which ruined dinner for one person. Food was tasty but not for those prices.

Top two best Thai restaurants in Charlotte, along with Basil Thai. Quaint little restaurant inside with not a lot of tables but you can usually get in without too much of a wait. My wife and I have tried a bunch of different dishes but the one I keep going back to is Pad Prik. It's got great flavor and just the right amount of spice. We've also tried some of the sushi and fish specials, most of which have been very good. Would highly recommend Deejai for anyone looking for top notch Thai food or a great date night.
The Tom kha gai soup was good.  Really liked the pad thai with tofu. Big portion. The peanut sauce was good!

Mom treated me to a birthday lunch yesterday.  We beat the lunch rush since we got there around 11.  Nicely decorated, cozy seating.  It looks like they also have a nice outdoor patio seating area when it's warmer.  Started off with complementary chicken rice soup (although the menu says free soup or salad with dine-in, we were not given the choice) and those addictive crunchy fried noodles with the sweet chili sauce.  Of course we ordered Pad Thai to honor the tradition of eating noodles on one's birthday "for long life".  It was yummy with the jumbo prawns.  We also tried the Pad Prik with seafood, but turned the spice dial down to mild. The second dish was just okay, and there was a higher proportion of rice to seafood and veggies.  We both split each meal and had enough to split a second smaller meal the next day.  Service was fast and friendly.  I would not mind going back to try a meat dish or their dinner menu.

Unrelated to this review...Thursday nights are underrated.  Or were they ever rated?  5 stars.  DEEJAI THAI.  The glowing neon letters make me feel like a mosquito.  You are just drawn to it!  I am no Thai aficionado, but I know that the Thai food that I have had, I have enjoyed.   I checked out Deejai with 4 other girlfriends.  This is the way to go for optimal sampling.  I began with the Paupia Sod or Basil Rolls.  These are the rolls wrapped in chewy clearish stuff.  I love these things.  I think what makes them so great though is the fact that you can dip them in basically peanut butter.  I had to ask for this on the side, as it is served with a spicy sauce.  Good, I just prefer the peanuts.  Give me a plate of peanut butter any day of the week.  My entree was the Gai Ma Kuer (Eggplant Chicken).  I am a huge fan of eggplant.  I just love it.  This was so delicious.  The chicken is diced up, taco style, and there are some great chunks of eggplant.  Portion size was filling, but let me just say I did not take home any leftovers.  I subbed brown rice for the jasmine rice.  A feeble "healthy choice" attempt.  $10.  I tried my friend's Panang Curry with chicken.  SO GOOD.  This is a milder curry, with all the sweetness of coconut milk that I just love.  The pad thai was also great.    Quick and friendly service, nice dimly lit atmosphere, and excellent food. I am sure you can get cheaper Thai food, but the prices I felt were reasonable.  For those sporadic Thai cravings, I will be back!
My favorite  restaurant  in Charlotte. Try the mango salad, any curry  or pad thai dish, and also they have fantastic sushi.

I love coming here with my lady. It's inexpensive, has generous portions and is amazingly delicious. The staff is ultra friendly and accommodating. Of the Thai places I have tried in Charlotte, this place is far and away the best.
The drunken noodles with Chicken were amazing.  Even better the next day when eaten as leftovers.  Great, fast service. And the sweet Sake in the pink bottle (not sure of the name) was the bomb.

Awesome!  This place was a StumbleUpon via Groupon.  I was having wine at a nearby swine bar with a friend and we were naturally hungry shortly after the event.  We did a Groupon for whats close and whalla! This place showed up.  We went and were promptly seated; that was a bonus since Groupon said to call ahead.  The service was good, nice atmosphere and clean bathroom (very important).  The Food OMG!!!  This was the best curry dish I have had to date (and I make curry frequently).  I had mine with the roasted duck, which was crisp to perfection.  We enjoyed it so much we bought another Groupon for 4 this time; we went back the next day.

I've only eaten Thai Food once in my adult years and I have to say that my second time around was far better than the first.  Deejai is a quiant little restaurant with great accents and location.  Our server was gracious enough to explain to me all the different options and totally choose a dish that she knew I'd love....which...I DID!!!!  I trusted her and she did not dissapoint.  My Hubs is a picky eater, but has come to at least try new things and he LOVED his dish as well.  I got the Pad Khing Sod Ginger Herb and it was yummmyyyy!!  Totally sold on Thai food now and I think I'll only come to this place!  Love being a newby in the Charlotte area! :)

Service is very slow.  Prices are a little outrageous, especially the sushi! I didn't try it because of the ridiculous prices.  My food was just a little boring, nothing special. My dessert was very overpriced and not how I had it before at other restaurants.  I got the mango sticky rice, and it was dry and dull. Probably won't come back.

The quality/price relationship doesn't get any better than this family owned Thai restaurant.  Excellent place to meet with friends or a business lunch.  Service is always good, and the food excellent.  I'm addicted to Panang Curry (with chicken), I often have to force myself to order something else.

got take out here twice when they first opened.  again, small portions and not at all spicy so i havent been back.  also pricey.  if i ask for thai spicy i at least expect to see some bird chilies in my food.  i have a thai cookbook so i guess i should just start making my own although its never the same.

My favorite place for Thai in Charlotte.  A little more expensive than it should be in my opinion, but tasty none the less.  2 items that I always order when having Thai is Pad Thai (something easy to bench mark across all Thai restaurants) and larb - my favorite Thai salad.  Both are great at Deejai.  I usually ask for a little spice to be added to the larb as they make it very mild.  Curries have all been good - quality pieces of meat are always used (isn't it the worst when you have a curry and get a dodgy piece of meat?!).  Another plus about Deejai is that it's just as good if you eat in, take out or use a delivery service. While I'm not a fan of Asian places that do 2 types of cuisine (why not just stick to one and make it great) the Thai side of the menu does not seem to suffer.  I've yet to try the Japanese items because it's a Thai restaurant.   Ambiance in the restaurant is nice, dark-ish, usually a fair amount of people which would make it a nice spot for date night, but isn't overly fancy.  Worth a try to satisfy your Thai craving.
Nice little Thai place on Providence Rd. in Charlotte. They have a sushi menu too but I went with lunch special, Pad Woonsen w/Tofu. Served with a small clear soup and crispy wontons.

This is my second time here and I can officially say, I'm a fan. Both times I have used a groupon, which makes it a great value. While it is small, the vibe is cool. We went on a random Tuesday night and they had a lot of people dining there.   I had the chicken pad thai. I like it spicy and I liked that they adjusted the heat to individual requests. My boyfriend had the drunken noodles with beef and loved it. We both shared spring rolls as an appetizer and they were delicious and very fresh.   My one complaint involves the Tuesday and Wednesday "half off wine" that is advertised. Only certain wines are included in this. We chose a Riesling, which the menu listed as $25 (so half off would've been $12.50). This was the only Riesling we saw on the menu, so we went with it when our waitress mentioned that the Riesling was included. Our total for the bottle was $15. So either they increased the prices on half off night or they sell you bottles that aren't even listed on the menu. Not the end of the world, but deceitful nonetheless.   We liked this place, although I can only see us going here with the groupon since it can be overpriced. Overall, it was good and we will be back.

Visited Deejai for the first time with friends on a couples date night. Was able to find a cool Groupon so why not try it out right lol.  Food was cooked well and it was very delicious. They have the typical array of curries and the calamari was pretty good. I judge a place by their calamari .   My friends being it was our first time asked our waitress what would see recommend and she seemed to give us a weird stare that lasted a few seconds. Maybe it was her way of thinking but the way it came across was almost rude or bothered. She eventually told us what is popular based on other customers but said she didn't eat the food here which almost sent up red flags but she could have been vegetarian. Anyway moving on.  Our food and drinks were well prepared so for food & drinks I would give Deejai 4 stars but for customer service it's more of a 2.5 or 3 stars. We didn't feel like our waitress was very friendly and don't recall her smiling once. Another thing that bothered us was, the restaurant was closing in 30 mins and she basically told us we couldn't order any more drinks and we felt like we were being pushed out.  My review is strictly based on food & drinks but feel the service could have been much better.

This had been on my list since I had heard it was one of the best Thai restaurants in Charlotte, so we finally decided to try it. Bonus: we got a Groupon for it.   For appetizers, we started with the spring rolls and pork sliders. I loved the spring rolls and the sauce they came with. I was a bit disappointed by the sliders. The inside was great, but they came on bao buns which are supposed to be soft and ours were very hard.   For our entrees we got the Spicy Lemongrass Beef and the Drunken Shrimp Noodles. Both were advertised as a spice level 3. I don't like really spicy food, but I thought the spiciness was a good amount. Neither of us liked the Lemongrass that much. You couldn't taste the Lemongrass flavor much. It was ok, but I wouldn't get it again. The Drunken Noodles were really good though. The shrimp was a little overcooked, but the sauce and noodles were a great combination. We both loved the dish.   We finished off with the sticky mango rice for dessert which I loved. My husband thought it was pretty good, but didn't like it as much as I did. The rice is what makes the dish -- it's sweet and perfectly cooked. The mangoes are a great addition. I wish you got a bit more ice cream with it though. It's a very unique dessert and I would definitely get it again.   All in all, I was a little disappointed compared to what I had heard about this place and I do think there is better Thai in Charlotte. I did enjoy it though and I would come back again.

I have yet to find Thai in Charlotte that really strikes my fancy, but I did happen to buy a Groupon for this place during one of my Groupon buying binges. A lot of times when a restaurant is offering a Groupon they are either new and trying to gain traction or they are struggling to stay afloat typically because of execution issues. Needless to say my expectations were a bit low.   Luckily for me the food was on point! I might be wrong, but I think there used to be a different Thai place here or they had the same name but a very different decor 3-4 years ago, either way the food matched my memory as being delicious. Ordered a few dishes to share family style and had plenty leftover! Red curry, drunken noodles, and saut√©ed eggplant were the selections of the night.   Drunken noodles were really good (5 Thai Spicy) hit the spot, but honestly I prefer the flatter noodles to the chunky ones. Either way still delicious and exactly what I needed carb wise with all this cold weather! The red curry (recommended by our server) honestly left a lot to be desired heavy on the coconut milk and light on the spices and flavor. Eh...not bad, but if you cook curry at home or are experienced in Asian cuisine you won't be impressed. The eggplant was delicious, but I guess I was thinking more eggplant less meat. Admittedly probably my screwed expectations after eating so much awesome eggplant over the past year in China (Yes, I know this is Thai not Chinese, but they do have a sushi bar...so fusion?).   Either way, definitely worth checking out the food is great. The service on the other hand could be improved. Asked two different people the specials of the night before getting an answer. Additionally had to waive down the waitress to order drinks other than water. Come on guys, up sell me.... please?!?
Local favorite. Really never go wrong here. Love the seafood coconut soup in hot pot to share.

Service here...  Is top notch!   Wait staff is friendly, helpful and service and facilities and presentation is quite nice too.  Drinks!   Good bar, we tried and now LOVE a fantastic Chinese beer, Tsing Tao Beer. It has a crisp finish and is very refreshing.  IMO, the ice tea should be skipped in lieu of something bottled.  My companion liked his Pinot Grigio.    Food: I was torn with the rating, because I simply didn't enjoy the food.  I ordered the Deejai Gai Krob which is very similar to Sesame Chicken. The waiter warned that it was sweet, but it tasted exactly like chicken stewed in ketchup, SALT, sugar, and barbeque sauce.  The three spears of broccoli, carrots and baby corn were served iced cold and completely flavorless with rubbery grains of white long rice.  My companion ordered the Green Curry which was really, really spicy and prepared with a strong coconut flavor.  He really enjoyed it.    I have two issues with the way the restaurant is run, here they are:         There is very little customizations allowed.  With the exception of how spicy you would like certain dishes, they won't allow you to have noodles rather than rice as the starch in your entr√©e, or any other customizations.  If you want fried rice, you must order a dish from the menu with precisely that. Don't even think your request to swap different vegetable out will be entertained.          Second, there are only three dessert selections.  I ordered the Chocolate Lava Cake, which was the best part of the meal.

Love this place! I've never had curry before and was afraid I wouldn't like it because I don't like spicy but it was GREAT and the heat was palpable. The service was awesome and so attentive. My server was so excited for my first curry experience lol. The ambiance was nice. I'll definitely be returning and drag my friends along with me- and I suggest you do the same!

I've been to Thailand and had Thai food, and this does not do it justice unfortunately. We had the Tom Kha soup, which was way too salty and sour. Normally it's a little sweet with the coconut milk and savory with prawns and mushrooms. It just wasn't good. I had the Pad Thai with shrimp. The shrimp were way overcooked and the pad thai was not good. It was really sticky in consistency and the flavor was not right. My husband had the mussaman curry with chicken, and we realized it was basically peanut sauce. I think the service was great, and I was happy to see the Singha and Chang beer, but the food was way overpriced and just not good.

It's between Deejai and Basil for the best Thai in Charlotte.    I love this place.  It has a nice decor which is tough to find at Thai restaurants.  I really appreciated the variety that the menu offers.  For example, being able to get some of the better sushi in Charlotte while at a Thai restaurant really allows you to get a good mix of flavors in one meal.     The prices are probably a buck or two higher per dish than most Thai restaurants and it's totally worth that modest premium.  I expect I will continue to come back here.

Went here for dinner with a group of ladies.  Love the expansive windows in this place.  Nice wine selection available, and our drink orders were taken quickly. Being a vegetarian typically makes ordering easy for me at most restaurants.  Not here!  The choices were nearly infinite.  I asked our server to take orders at the opposite end of our table while I struggled to make my decision.  When my friends had finished ordering, the server completely forgot to ask me what I wanted.   My indecisiveness almost cost me a good meal!  I called her back, and we all had a good laugh. I got the spicy lemongrass because my friend Jeff had it before and loved it.  I somehow overlooked the fact that it features green beans, which I don't care for, but there weren't that many.  It also came with onions,  bell pepper, Thai chili and basil.  I requested tofu as the meat.  It was served a "3" which is Thai spicy.  It was delicious, but I still needed to add hot sauce.  I love to give my tongue a good slapping! Great experience.  This is a repeater!

The food was excellent and our waitress was great as well. The problem came at 10:15pm when we were not even halfway through our bottle of wine and they turned the lights up. For the next 30 minutes while we felt forced to chug our wine, we continued to get stares and one waiter even jiggled his keys for the entire time until we got up with half full glasses of wine left and he swooped in and cleared our table before we even left the restaurant. Experience was great until 10:15pm when we felt unwelcome which ruined our opinion of the restaurant. It's too bad!

Decent Thai food! I tried the panang curry and crab rangoons. I liked the curry because it wasn't spicy, but I would have liked it more if the vegetables were more cooked. Altogether it was a good, hearty meal!

Came here for a I'm-too-lazy-too-cook-tonight meal with my girlfriend and I'm really glad I did.  Rolled up around 6:30 and was able to come right in and order, but by the time we left around 7 the place was packed. It is definitely known around town as a great spot.   As for the food, the flavor was off the charts and the portions are a good size (aka. you won't leave hungry).
Ambience and food was great. Waitress was very friendly. I will be back. Drunken Noodles and pork belly appetizer were great

I've had avacado salad and spring rolls in this place. Spring rolls were okay not particularly tasty. Avacado salad was not good, parts of the avacadoes were dark and shrimp was about to go bad. Servers were nice but I won't be back.

I really want to like deejai and I've been four or five times to try to build the relationship that just isn't there. Every time I've eaten here the server doesn't write down my order and, predictably, messes it up big time. And then offers nothing more than a "sorry."   These have all been simple orders like pad Thai with chicken, pad see ew with tofu, etc. One time the pad Thai came out at the highest spice level because, according to the server, when I didn't specify the heat level he just assumed I'd want it as spicy as possible. My dish originally arrived much later than my husbands and then by the time the server brought out a revised dish (the first one's spice was UNBEARABLE), my husband had already finished his dish and what was supposed to be a lovely dinner together was, well, ruined.   Another time the dish I ordered with tofu came out with chicken. I told the waiter server this and he apologized and asked if I wanted him to send it back. It was almost 10pm on a Friday and the kitchen was closed so I said I'd just deal with it.   In my opinion, when these type of thing happen, the restaurant should offer some kind of peace offering - a coupon, discount, free drink - something! Deejai did not and with prices like that, it simply isn't worth it for me to keep trying to love it. Sorry, deejai!

The quality of food is below average for a Thai. I'm sad to fin that the service lacks too. I didn't have tableware, at no point did I see my server until I asked for the check, and I had to go to the bar to get more water. This was a terrible experience.

We were in the mood for Asian, so thought we'd try something outside our usual. We ordered the three amigos sushi which was good so we were expecting good things for the main courses. I had to send back my cashew chicken. I am not sure if it is the sauce or something was left on the wok but it tasted funny. I got the pad Thai which was extremely sweet and I wasn't a fan of it. Not at all what I was expecting. My girlfriend ordered the mountain beef. It was just okay, but also a little on the sweet side. We won't be coming back to try again.

This was a wonderful surprise. My parental units were tired and asked if I would bring home some grub. I wasn't in the mood for the usual pick up and take home - so decided Thai and something on the way to get my girls their dog food as well. So Yelp pointed me this direction.. They are def on my de-lish list.   I was immediately greeted once entered. I sat at the bar, ordered a chardonnay while I looked over the menu.   I ordered the Basil Fresh Rolls, Tom Kha soup with Tofu, Pad Thai Beef and the green curry with tofu as well, this was plenty of food for 3. I even had left over's for the next day  Man, it was damn good! It is a bit pricey, but worth it! I will be going back for sure!

An incredibly disappointing meal. Pad Khing with beef had absolutely no ginger (or flavor in general) and had the taste and consistency of microwaved lean cuisine. The only flavor to the Prik Pao with chicken was the red pepper/chili oil, which, to its credit, made it slightly more palatable than the Pad Khing. The vegetables on both dishes were soggy and flavorless. Likewise, the fresh rolls tasted like they were rolled the day before, with wilted lettuce and a rubbery wrapper.  We ordered relatively simple dishes. The food we received suggests that the quality of the ingredients and the skill of the cooks are both woefully lacking.

Overall, I was very pleased with the food, service and atmosphere here. There was some great live music (a guitar player/singer playing some old blues and jazz), and the d√©cor was very nice. It was almost too dark though.  To start, we ordered the Hiyachi Wakame (seaweed salad), the spring rolls, and the basil rolls. The seaweed salad came out served in a large martini glass, which was a nice touch, and was quite tasty. I also loved the spring rolls. I can't say what exactly was unique about them, but both the rolls and the sauce were fantastic. The basil rolls were also pretty good - pretty much the same as you get as most Thai restaurants.  For entrees, we had some sushi - both the yellowtail and tuna - and the Spicy Lemongrass Pad Takrai. The yellowtail was great - I would go back just for this, and the pad takrai was good as well.  I will probably come back next time I am in town, even if it is just to enjoy the music and some drinks.

This is the only Charlotte restaurant I crave consistently even when I'm not pregnant.   When my husband and I first moved to the area three years ago, my first task was to find the best Thai place. After trying a few different places, I stumbled across Deejai due to a movie showing at The Manor and haven't set foot in any of the other restaurants since.   I schedule every possible lunch date and dinner date at Deejai. When family comes from out of town, we go to Deejai. When we order takeout for a night in, it's Deejai.   I'm rambling.  Why do I love Deejai? First of all, the lunch options are one of the best deals around. Most of the more popular meals are under $10 and come with a sample appetizer and soup for free. Meals themselves are cooked to perfection, whether meat, vegetable, or noodle. Their spices and flavors are always spot-on.   My favorite dishes are the Pad Thai with Chicken (the staple of every Thai restaurant) and the Yellow Curry. My husband has tried several entrees and now ends up getting the Panang Curry most every time we go in. If you're looking for an appetizer, do yourself a favor and order the crab rangoon- it is never greasy or soggy like you'd find at most Asian places. The chicken satay is also incredible- but that might be my partiality to the peanut sauce that comes with it!   I might keep rambling, so I'm going to force myself to stop now. It's just that after living in several different cities I know how hard it is to find a Thai restaurant that consistently delivers over and over again and Deejai is IT.

Used a Groupon with a bunch of friends. In a major lapse of judgment, I forgot to make a reservation for 9 people on a Saturday night. Fortunately, the staff was very accommodating and pulled together 3 tables within about 15 or 20 minutes.  My fianc√© ordered the Mango Salad and I ordered the Spicy Crab Avocado Salad. We also shared a Scallop Lovers specialty sushi roll. For dessert we ordered the Mango Sticky Rice.  The best dish by far was the mango salad. We ordered a 5 spiciness (out of 5) and it was legit spicy. It was delicious and our mouths were dancing long after we finished. It's rare that we find sufficiently spicy food when we eat out but this place wasn't messing around. Others at the table couldn't handle the spiciness, but that's their loss!  The spicy crab avocado salad was very good as well, but it was way too small for the $10 price. The seaweed salad was dressed to perfection.  The scallop lovers sushi roll was a bit of a disappointment. It tasted good, but the scallop inside the roll was dominated by the taste of the fried scallop on top and all of the sauce. It wasn't worth the $16.  Finally, the mango sticky rice was only average. The rice was yummy and the ice cream was an interesting touch. However, the mango wasn't particularly fresh and there wasn't enough of it.
